Frost Death Knight Mythic+ Guide

11.1 - Undermine(d)

Last Updated:February 25, 2025|Changelog|FAQ

Welcome to the Frost Death Knight Mythic+ guide for the World of Warcraft patch 11.1! This guide covers everything you need to know to understand your character! Are you starting out and leveling up from 70? Check out the leveling guide!

Overview

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight
Frost Death KnightMythic+
Single Target
Average
AoE
Excellent
Utility
Weak
Survivability
Excellent
Mobility
Weak

Hero Talents

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight
  • As a Frost Death Knight you have the two Hero Talent trees
    Deathbringer and
    Rider of the Apocalypse that are currently balanced well against each other. They excel in different situations and have synergies with certain builds so what you play very much depends on what build you are playing.
 Deathbringer
Rider of the Apocalypse
Offensive Nodes
  • Reaper's Mark
    • The explosion grants you 2 stacks of
      Exterminate      .
  • Wave of Souls
    • Makes you deal up to 20% increased Shadowfrost damage to your main target, and up to 10% to additional enemies that it hits.
  • Wither Away
    • Exterminate       refreshes or applies
      Frost Fever       and makes it do its' damage in half the duration. This is incredibly powerful in Single-Target and even stronger in AoE.
  • Bind in Darkness
    • Rime       empowered
      Howling Blasts       now deal 30% more damage to its main target.
  • Soul Rupture
    • When
      Reaper's Mark       explodes it deals damage to nearby enemies.
  • Swift and Painful
    • A nice single target increase that grants you Strength if
      Reaper's Mark       explodes and does not hit any other targets with
      Soul Rupture      .
    • Increases
      Wave of Souls       effectiveness by 100% on your main target, making it a 20% damage increase if both hits of
      Wave of Souls       crit your target.
Offensive Choice Nodes
  • Grim Reaper     vs
    Reaper of Souls
    • Grim Reaper       gives you a stack of
      Killing Machine       when you press
      Reaper's Mark       and increases the damage of
      Reaper's Mark       depending on your target's missing health making this incredibly strong and the best choice in all scenarios as it increases both single target and aoe damage with
      Soul Rupture      .
    • Reaper of Souls       is in the unfortunate position of buffing a spell that we rarely press and takes up an extra extremely valuable global during
      Pillar of Frost       to use it effectively for not enough of a damage gain.
  • Dark Talons     vs
    Reaper's Onslaught
    • Dark Talons       is always the winner here as extra stacks of
      Icy Talons       are quite good to allow for more
      Killing Machine       and
      Icy Death Torrent       procs.
    • Reaper's Onslaught       has no synergy with the current talent builds that we play as it desyncs
      Reaper's Mark       from
      Pillar of Frost      .
Defensive Choice Nodes
  • Pact of the Deathbringer     or
    Rune Carved Plates
    • Pact of the Deathbringer       is not a good enough talent to consider as it puts up a random healing absorb which in some cases can be extremely detrimental. On the other side you have
      Rune Carved Plates       which is incredibly strong as it is a passive damage reduction based on what abilities you use. During your cooldowns this is essentially a 10% magic and physical damage taken reduction as you are constantly refreshing them.
  • Death's Messenger     or
    Expelling Shield
    • Death's Messenger       is the clear choice here as
      Expelling Shield       does not work in PvE content on casts where it matters.
Offensive Nodes
  • Rider's Champion     - Each Rune spent gives you a 10% chance to summon one of the following Four Horsemen:
    • Mograine
      • Puts up a
        Death and Decay         that follows him.
        • You gain the benefit of
          Mograine's Might           and
          Unholy Ground           if you are standing in this.
    • Whitemane
      • Undeath         is a disease with a 24 second duration that spreads and gains 1 stack every time you use
        Obliterate         on the infected target.
    • Trollbane
      • Repeatedly casts
        Chains of Ice         over his duration that gets shattered by
        Obliterate         with
        Trollbane's Icy Fury        .
    • Nazgrim
      • Grants you 5% Strength, increasing by 1% for every Rune spent while Nazgrim is active.
  • Apocalypse Now
    • Summons all 4 Horsemen for 20 seconds after casting
      Frostwyrm's Fury       making
      Absolute Zero       mandatory to line this up with every other use of
      Pillar of Frost       allowing for huge burst every 1m30s.
      • If a Horsemen is already out, it extends the current duration by 20 seconds instead.
        • Mograine           does not recast his
          Death and Decay           but all other Horsemen recast their abilities.
  • Hungering Thirst
    • Passively increases
      Frost Fever       and
      Frost Strike       damage.
  • Mawsworn Menace
    • Increases
      Obliterate       damage by 10% and reduces the cooldown of
      Death and Decay       by 10 seconds allowing you to use 2 charges of
      Death and Decay       during
      Pillar of Frost       in AoE.
Offensive Choice Nodes
  • Fury of the Horsemen     or
    A Feast of Souls
    • Fury of the Horsemen       increases the duration of your Horsemen while they are up but
      A Feast of Souls       enables massive
      Frost Strikes       periodically and is prolonged during
      Apocalypse Now      . When combined with
      Shattering Blade       and
      Shattered Frost       this is especially powerful. As this is purely a numbers difference,
      A Feast of Souls       currently wins when paired with
      Shattering Blade      .
Defensive Choice Nodes
  • Death Charge     or
    On a Paler Horse
    • On a Paler Horse       does not work at all in this raid so you always choose
      Death Charge       which is not a bad thing as this greatly increases your mobility and allows you to break roots and slows.
  • Horsemen's Aid     or
    Pact of the Apocalypse
    • Horsemen's Aid       depends on the value of
      Anti-Magic Shell       during the fight as this can be incredibly potent allowing you to pre-immune debuffs or randomly absorb high amounts of magic damage. On the other hand,
      Pact of the Apocalypse       grants you 5% damage reduction per Horsemen out or a 20% damage reduction during your cooldowns with
      Apocalypse Now      . Due to the situational value of both of these, there is no auto pick for this as it just depends on the fight.

Talents

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight
 Deathbringer
Shattering Blade
Riders

 Deathbringer
Breath of Sindragosa

Gameplay Altering Talents

Discover all talents that significantly alter your gameplay within the Spec and Class Talent trees. This section gives a concise overview of these talents and their applications but for a more detailed look check out the Rotation and Deep Dive sections below.

Spec Tree

  • Unleashed Frenzy     and
    Icy Talons
    • Both of these buffs have the same duration and are refreshed by the same abilities. Keeping both active is very important!
  • Everfrost    ,
    Biting Cold    , and
    Gathering Storm
    • All of these talents combined drastically increase your
      Remorseless Winter       damage which contributes a good amount of single-target damage and is a very noticeable portion of your AoE.
  • Arctic Assault
    • Sends out a
      Glacial Advance       towards your facing that applies
      Razorice       to all enemies hit and refreshes both
      Unleashed Frenzy       and
      Icy Talons      .
    • This does not require you to talent into
      Glacial Advance       for this to work and does not interact with
      Runic Empowerment      .
  • Pillar of Frost    ,
    Icecap    , and
    Frostwhelp's Aid
    • Pillar of Frost       is a Frost Death Knight's major cooldown every 45 seconds when talented into
      Icecap      .
  • Obliteration
    • Makes you gain a massive amount of
      Killing Machine       buffs during your
      Pillar of Frost       subsequently making it an incredibly high burst window as you can slam massive
      Killing Machine       empowered
      Obliterates       constantly.
  • Empower Rune Weapon
    • Increases your Haste by 15% for 20 seconds and gives you a Rune on use and every 5 seconds afterwards. This is very nice for your
      Pillar of Frosts       as this allows you to fit in extra global cooldowns during this timeframe.
  • Shattering Blade
    • When Dual-Wielding, you gain the benefit of being able to apply 2 Runeforges to your weapons. As this build, putting
      Rune of Razorice       on your main-hand weapon allows
      Razorice       to stack up very quickly because your main-hand hits of Auto Attack,
      Obliterate       and
      Frost Strike       now apply a stack of
      Razorice       to the target.
  • Shattered Frost
    • Paired with
      Shattering Blade       this talent is extremely strong as this essentially allows your
      Frost Strike       to cleave.

Class Tree

  • Cleaving Strikes
    • Cleaving Strikes       allows your
      Obliterate       to hit up to 2 additional enemies while you are standing in
      Death and Decay       or when you have the buff from recently standing in your
      Death and Decay       that lasts for 4 seconds.
  • Abomination Limb
    • Grips enemies to you for 12 seconds with a minimum range of 8 yards and a max range of 20 yards as well as dealing a decent amount of damage over the duration.
  • Runic Attenuation
    • A very nice source of passive Runic Power generation to help smooth out your rotation.
  • Anti-Magic Zone     and
    Assimilation
    • Your raid cooldown that lasts for either 8 seconds or until 150% of your maximum health has been absorbed in total by everyone standing in the zone.
    • Talenting into
      Assimilation       makes this absorb 10% stronger, 165% of your maximum health, and its' cooldown is reduced by 30 seconds.
  • Null Magic
    • Reduces your magic damage taken by 5% and reduces the duration of harmful magic effects by 35%. While the reduced magic damage portion of
      Null Magic       works against all magic damage, the reduced duration of harmful magic effects does not work on the vast majority of amount debuffs in Raid as that could simply break too many things.
  • Death's Echo
    • Gives you 1 extra charge of
      Death and Decay      ,
      Death's Advance      , and
      Death Grip      .
  • Will of the Necropolis
    • Reduces all damage taken below 30% by 35%, including the portion of the hit that takes you below 30%. For example, if you take a hit that takes you from 60% to 10%, the portion of the hit below 30% of your health is reduced by 35%
  • Unholy Endurance
    • Transforms
      Lichborne       into a defensive cooldown and increases its' duration.
  • Gloom Ward
    • Increases all absorbs on you by 15%, this is incredibly powerful as it increases the absorb of spells like
      Anti-Magic Shell       and
      Power Word: Shield       and other similar abilities.

Runeforges

  • Main-Hand
    • Rune of Razorice
  • Off-Hand
    • Rune of the Fallen Crusader

When to use this Spec

This build is ultimately less consistent damage than the

Deathbringer variant of this build, but is burstier on single target and when
Reaper's Mark does not proc.

Talent Adjustments

Listing all the changes within the Class and Spec tree compared to the default build.

    • Rider of the Apocalypse
    • Absolute Zero
  • Removed
    •  Deathbringer

Runeforges

  • Off-Hand

When to use this Spec

There is not currently a set fight where you would currently use this spec on as this is very timer dependent as well as the ability to stay in melee, however this build could prove useful in Mythic.

Rotation

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight

Tier Set

  • 2-Set: Your spells and abilities have a chance to activate a
    Winning Streak!     increasing the damage of your
    Frost Strike     and
    Glacial Advance     by 4% stacking up to 6 times.
    Frost Strike     and
    Glacial Advance     have a 7% chance to remove
    Winning Streak!    .
  • 4-Set:
    Winning Streak!     causes
    Frost Strike     and
    Glacial Advance     to have a 8% chance to cast
    Frostscythe     per stack at 30% effectiveness. Losing
    Winning Streak!     sends you into a
    Murderous Frenzy    , casting
    Frostscythe     at 100% effectiveness and gaining 12% Mastery for 6 sec. Additionally,
    Frostscythe     deals 40% more damage to the first target struck.

Single-Target

Shattering Blade
Breath of Sindragosa

Opener

  • Your goal is to activate your high powered cooldowns going in to
    Pillar of Frost     and then cast as many
    Killing Machine     empowered
    Obliterates     and 5 stack
    Razorice     empowered
    Frost Strikes     during your
    Pillar    . Below is an example of how your opener should look for the first few casts.

During
Pillar of Frost Priority

  • Cast
    Frost Strike     when the target has 5 stacks of
    Razorice    .
  • Cast
    Obliterate     when you have a
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     if
    Frost Fever     is missing and you do not have a stack of
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     when you have
    Rime    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     if you do not have a
    Killing Machine    .

Standard Priority

This is the priority list you follow while

Pillar of Frost is not active.

  • Cast
    Frost Strike     if
    Icy Talons     and
    Unleashed Frenzy     are about to expire.
  • Cast
    Remorseless Winter    .
  • Cast
    Pillar of Frost    .
    • Cast
      Frostwyrm's Fury       with
      Pillar       when possible.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     when you 2 stacks of
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike     if you have 5
    Razorice     stacks on your target.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     when you have a
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     when you have
    Rime    .
  • Cast
    Soul Reaper     if the enemy is below 35% health.
  • Cast
    Obliterate    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike    .
  • Cast
    Abomination Limb    .

Notes

  • If you are playing the
    Deathbringer variant of this build the only change is to replace
    Frostwyrm's Fury     with
    Reaper's Mark    .

Opener

  • This is an example of an opener on Single Target when talented into
    Breath of Sindragosa    .
  • In the
    Breath of Sindragosa     opener, how fast you get in to
    Breath of Sindragosa     depends on what procs you get. If you get a lot of procs you can delay up until the point where you are capped on Runic Power.
  • In a sense, the same thing goes for
    Empower Rune Weapon    . This can be delayed if you end up going in to
    Breath     with high amounts of resources, but it is very normal to have to use it right with
    Pillar     on pull as it is not normal to get an excessive amount of procs.

During
Breath Priority List

  • Cast
    Reaper's Mark     when it is ready.
  • Cast
    Pillar of Frost     when it is ready.
  • Cast
    Remorseless Winter     if you are not in
    Pillar of Frost    .
    • While in
      Pillar      , if you are above 60 Runic Power, do not have a
      Killing Machine       or
      Rime       proc, and
      Remorseless Winter       is already stacked, you can refresh
      Remorseless Winter      .
  • Cast
    Soul Reaper     if the enemy is below 35% health and you have more than 50 Runic Power.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     if you are not above 80 Runic Power and have a
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     when you have
    Rime     and you have more than 60 Runic Power.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     if you are not above 80 Runic Power.
  • Cast
    Horn of Winter     if you are not wasting Runic Power and Runes.
  • Cast
    Death and Decay    .

Priority While not in
Breath

  • Cast
    Frost Strike     if
    Icy Talons     and
    Unleashed Frenzy     are about to expire.
  • Cast
    Remorseless Winter    .
  • Cast
    Reaper's Mark     when it is ready.
  • Cast
    Pillar of Frost     when it is available.
  • Cast
    Soul Reaper     if the enemy is below 35% health or will be when this expires.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     when you have a
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     when you have
    Rime    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike    .
  • Cast
    Obliterate    .
  • Cast
    Horn of Winter     if you are not wasting Runic Power and
    Breath of Sindragosa     has more than 30 seconds remaining on its' cooldown.
  • Cast
    Abomination Limb     if you have nothing else.

During
Pillar of Frost Priority

This priority is used during

Pillar of Frost while not in
Breath.

  • Cast
    Obliterate     when you have a
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Soul Reaper     if the enemy is below 35% health and you do not have a
    Killing Machine     as well as having at least 2 Runes.
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     if
    Frost Fever     is missing.
  • Cast
    Frost Strike     if you have 5
    Razorice     stacks on your target.
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     when you have
    Rime    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     if you do not have a
    Killing Machine    .

AoE

    Obliterates     and 5 stack

    Frost Strikes     during your

During
Pillar of Frost Priority

  • Cast
    Death and Decay     if
    Pillar of Frost     has more than 5 seconds remaining and it is not already down.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     when you have a
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike     when the target has 5 stacks of
    Razorice    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     if
    Frost Fever     is missing and you do not have a stack of
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     when you have
    Rime    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     if you do not have a

Standard Priority

This is the priority list you follow while

Pillar of Frost is not active.

  • Cast
    Frost Strike     if
    Icy Talons     and
    Unleashed Frenzy     are about to expire.
  • Cast
    Remorseless Winter    .
  • Cast
    Pillar of Frost    .
    • Cast
      Frostwyrm's Fury       with
      Pillar       when possible.
  • Cast
    Death and Decay
    • Make sure you have a charge of Cast
      Death and Decay       for your
      Pillar       window, it is far more important than using
      Death and Decay       outside of it.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     when you 2 stacks of
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike     if you have 5
    Razorice     stacks on your target.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     when you have a
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     when you have
    Rime    .
  • Cast
    Soul Reaper     if the enemy is below 35% health.
  • Cast
    Obliterate    .
  • Cast
    Frost Strike    .
  • Cast
    Abomination Limb    .

Notes

  • If you are playing the
    Deathbringer variant of this build the only change is to replace
    Frostwyrm's Fury     with
    Reaper's Mark    .
  • Death and Decay     essentially has a 14 second duration as you gain 4 seconds of the buff after it expires so watch out for that before refreshing during
    Pillar of Frost    !

Opener

  • This is an example of an opener on AoE when talented into
    Breath of Sindragosa    .
  • In the
    Breath of Sindragosa     opener, how fast you get in to
    Breath of Sindragosa     depends on what procs you get. If you get a lot of procs you can delay up until the point where you are capped on Runic Power or when
    Reaper's Mark     is about to explode as you want to get that in
    Pillar of Frost    .
  • In a sense, the same thing goes for
    Empower Rune Weapon    . This can be delayed if you end up going in to
    Breath     with high amounts of resources, but it is very normal to have to use it right with
    Pillar     on pull as it is not normal to get an excessive amount of procs.

During
Breath Priority List

    Reaper's Mark     when it is ready.

    Pillar of Frost    .
    • While in
      Pillar      , if you are above 60 Runic Power, do not have a

      Rime       proc, and
      Remorseless Winter       is already stacked, you can refresh
      Remorseless Winter      .
  • Cast
    Death and Decay    .
  • Cast
    Soul Reaper     if the enemy is below 35% health and you have more than 50 Runic Power.
    • This is only cast if you have 1 or 2 targets, never 3 or above.
  • Cast
    Obliterate     if you are not above 80 Runic Power and have a
    Killing Machine    .
  • Cast
    Howling Blast     when you have
    Rime     and you have more than 60 Runic Power.

Deep Dive

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight

Cooldown Usage

This section explains how and when to use your cooldowns as it is very important for your damage as a Frost Death Knight.

Pillar of Frost
Empower Rune Weapon
Horn of Winter
Abomination Limb
Raise Dead

Shattering Blade

Death and Decay

When playing

Deathbringer
Shattering Blade,
Pillar is always paired with
Reaper's Mark and has no exceptions to this rule as they have the same cooldown. With
Deathbringer, getting good use from
Frostwhelp's Aid is extremely important if you are given the opportunity, so don't be afraid to hold it if it is necessary, but not so long that you waste uses without them being saved for a reason.

When playing the

Riders
Shattering Blade variation,
Pillar of Frost is used mostly on cooldown, held only for a short period of time to get extra value from
Frostwhelp's Aid. This is paired with a macro to cast
Frostwyrm's Fury immediately after
Pillar to summon your four horsemen. As every other use is not paired with
Frostwyrm's Fury, you should send it on cooldown, or again when you can get value from
Frostwhelp's Aid without losing good uses of
Pillar of Frost paired with
Frostwyrm's Fury over the course of the dungeon.

Breath of Sindragosa

When playing

Breath,
Pillar of Frost gets offset from
Breath as the cooldown does not line up with 45 second
Pillar. Even with this offset, you still use
Pillar on cooldown with
Reaper's Mark as it is too powerful to delay. You want to go into
Pillar with at least 3 Runes and preferably a
Remorseless Winter to help stack
Reaper's Mark.

When

Breath is on cooldown, having an extra rune available for
Death and Decay is very nice as it allows you to pop
Reaper's Mark much faster and if it procs to give you another
Reaper's Mark, you can get both
Exterminates of the second
Reaper's Mark in your
Pillar window.

Shattering Blade

While you are playing

Shattering Blade, you want to pair this with
Pillar of Frost. The 15% Haste this grants allows you to fit in more global cooldowns into your
Pillar window so this is especially important. It can be used up to 2 seconds before
Pillar because of
The Long Winter extending your
Pillar to 18 seconds.

While playing

Riders, you want to use this as often as possible with your
Frostwyrm's Fury +
Pillar pop, but you do not want to hold
Empower Rune Weapon for it, unless it is necessary or worth it for your next pull.

Breath of Sindragosa

As

Breath of Sindragosa,
Empower Rune Weapon usage is not black and white due to the varying amount of resources you get. Sim usage says to use this when you are below 70 Runic Power and have less than 3 Runes but that gets more complicated with the extra
Reaper's Mark procs as you get 2 reduced cost
Obliterates. If you know you are about to get these resources, it can be beneficial to hold this until after to not excessively overcap on resources after using
Empower Rune Weapon.

Breath of Sindragosa

As you usually only talent into this with

Breath of Sindragosa, this is only used when you do not have Runes to spend on an
Obliterate, or a
Rime empowered
Howling Blast when talented in to
Rage of the Frozen Champion and you do not overcap on Runic Power and Runes when casting.

You can use this once outside of

Breath of Sindragosa and is generally used well around the time you cast
Reaper's Mark as you are regularly running out of resources around that time.

Use this as a filler global when you have nothing else to press or when walking in to packs. It does not deal enough damage to be worth pressing otherwise. If you can, try to use it when you can get value going in to

Pillar of Frost or after with
Enduring Strength.

You should macro this in with either of

Pillar of Frost or
Empower Rune Weapon as this does not do enough to offset from either of these.

Anti-Magic Shell Runic Power

  • Anti-Magic Shell     grants you up to 40 Runic Power based on the amount it absorbs. This is incredibly powerful as you do get quite starved on Runic Power so you end up wanting to use this to your advantage as often as possible on bosses where
    Anti-Magic Shell     isn't specifically used for defensive purposes.

Understanding Mechanics

Rotational min-maxing is just one aspect of mastering a specialization, but there are numerous other key mechanics that influence your performance. Use the following guides to improve them.

  • Spell Queue Window
  • Stat Diminishing Returns

    Anti-Magic Shell     on
    Burning Fermentation    .
  • It is important to never let the Brew Drops reach I'pa.
    • Crowd control the Brew Drops with
      Death Grip       and
      Chains of Ice       if absolutely necessary.

Benk Buzzbee

  • Keep your
    Icebound Fortitude     or
    Lichborne     incase you get a lot of
    Shredding Sting     stacks.
  • It is a good idea to use
    Anti-Magic Shell     on
    Fluttering Wing     as it is the only magic damage event in the fight.
  • Once you kill a Ravenous Cinderbee you can mount up on them
    Tamed    , and kill the
    Snack Time    .

Goldie Baronbottom

  • Avoid the front of the boss at all costs to dodge the
    Cash Cannon    .
  • Keep the room clean from
    Cinder-BOOM!     and burn the barrels with
    Burning Ricochet    .
    • Be aware that clearing up multiple of the barrels does apply a deadly dot on all players
      Cindering Wounds      .
  • The boss casts
    Let It Hail!     upon reaching 100 Energy, use
    Anti-Magic Shell    ,
    Icebound Fortitude    , or
    Lichborne     on it.
    • Keep in mind that all the Cinderbrew Bombs explode and if you have
      Cinder-BOOM!       on the ground you want to press even more personals and a healthpotion or healthstone.

Trash Tips

  • Single targeting the Yes Man is important, as they full heal themselves as one of them dies with
    Field Promotion    .
  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Boiling Flames       from Venture Co. Pyromaniac.
    • Free Samples?       from Taste Tester.
    • Rejuvenating Honey       from Flavor Scientist.
    • Bee-stial Wrath       from Bee Wrangler.
    • Honey Volley       from Royal Jelly Purveyor.
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Throw Chair       from Hired Muscle.
      • Inflicts physical damage to a random player. Make sure you are always full health whenever getting targeted by this spell. Always be ready to press a strong defensive like
        Icebound Fortitude         or
        Lichborne        .
    • Reckless Delivery       from Careless Hopgoblin
      • Targets a player and the Careless Hopgoblin charges towards the direction of the player, make sure to bait it close to the trash pack that you are fighting so he does not move very far away.
    • Failed Batch       from Flavor Scientist.
      • Summons a Failed Batch that starts a 10 second cast which will inflict AoE fire damage to all players upon succeeding. Swap to it as soon as it spawns to kill it as quickly as possible.
    • Swarming Surprise       from Venture Co. Honey Harvester.
      • An AoE cast that ramps in damage done per cast.
  • Dangerous debuffs to be wary of:
    • Erupting Inferno       from Venture Co. Pyromaniac.
    • Shredding Sting       from Worker Bee.
      • A stacking Bleed that is applied to random players. Use
        Icebound Fortitude         or
        Lichborne         if you get multiple of those stacks.

          Anti-Magic Shell           before it happens. While it is rng if it prevents a debuff or not, it can be extremely helpful when it does.

    • Bloodthirsty Cackle       from Darkfuse Hyena.

      • You can stun these as well but they will recast untill interrupted.

  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Wind Up       from Loaderbot.
      • Fixates a random player, inflicting physical damage to players within 3.5 yards for 6 seconds. Don't be in melee or close to the mob whenever it happens.
    • Shreddation       from Shreddinator 3000.
      • Summons several spinning sawblades at the location of every player, inflicting physical damage every 0.3 seconds to players within the effect. This damage increases with consecutive hits. Damage can be fully avoided by prerunning out of it before the cast finishes.
    • Flamethrower       from Shreddinator 3000.
      • It can be very spicy to dodge the
        Shreddation         and the
        Flamethrower         at the same time, in the worst case scenario get out of melee.
    • Rapid Construction       from Venture Co. Architect.
      • While the Scaffolding is up, the Venture Co. Architect is buffed by
        High Ground        .
        • Focus the Scaffolding to remove
          High Ground           as fast as possible.
  • Dangerous debuffs to be wary of:
    • Overcharge       from Venture Co. Electrician.
      • Applies a Magic debuff to a random player, inflicting nature damage and stuns if the effect persists without being dispelled.

        Anti-Magic Shell         on it to mitigate damage or instead use
        Icebound Fortitude         or
        Lichborne         if there are multiple in the pack and they are casting back to back.

      • Channeled cast that fixates on a random player and inflicts holy damage every second for 6 seconds.
    • Burst of Light       Lightspawn.
      • Use
        Death Grip         to keep any mob out of the
        Burst of Light         as this heals them to full.

    • Pounce       from War Lynx.
      • A Bleed effect inflicting physical damage for 14 seconds or until fully healed.
    • Impale       from Arathi Knight.
      • A Bleed that is applied to a random player.
    • Heat Wave       from Forge Master Damian.
      • A Magic slow debuff for 4 seconds. In combination with
        Molten Pools         can be very deadly.

      Chaotic Vulnerability       to avoid getting
      Chaotic Corruption       on accident.

    Reality Tear     from his impact, be aware and dodge it.

    Anti-Magic Shell     and
    Icebound Fortitude     or
    Lichborne     when afflicted by
    Unleash Corruption    .

Boss Tips

      Death's Advance       this if wanted.

    Lichborne     on
    Might of Maldraxxus    .

      Raging Tantrum

Affixes

The Affix system got revamped going into The War Within Season 1 retiring most Affixes as well as introducing new kiss-curse ones while also changing on which key level these appear.

  • +4 Affixes -- Rotates on a weekly basis
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Pulsar
  • +7 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis
    • Tyrannical
    • Fortified
  • +10 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis, is always the opposite of the +7 Affix
    • Tyrannical
    • Fortified
  • +12 Affix
    • Xal'atath's Guile       -- Replaces the +4 Affix

Following you get some useful tips for handling different Mythic+ Affixes as a Frost Death Knight

  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • Hit as many orbs as possible with
      Blinding Sleet
    • Death Grip       the far orbs if they are by themselves.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • Focus and cleave off of this target as mobs take reduced damage while it is alive.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • Soak any orbs that are close in melee.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
    • Dispel this with
      Unyielding Will       if you are playing it.
    • If you have taken a considerable amount of damage in the last few seconds, you can use 1
      Death Strike       to help out your healer.

Stat Priority

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight

Understand your secondary stat priority and the tertiary stats needed for optimal performance during Mythic+ dungeons as a Frost Death Knight. For more detailed information, visit the Stats and Attributes guide.

Shattering Blade
Breath of Sindragosa

While this looks odd,

Shattering Blade wants a relatively equal amount of Crit, Mastery, and Haste as they are all very good and important for the build.

Please note that

Deathbringer prefers Crit and Mastery more than
Riders as it does not scale as much with Haste.

!
Higher Item Level Items are Better in Most Scenarios

For an accurate representation of what item to equip you should use Simcraft!

A static "Stat Priority" is just a starting point and can easily shift depending on your current gear.

  • All secondary stats are affected by diminishing returns. Click here to learn more!

Tertiary

  • Avoidance - Great stat to reduce the damage intake of "Area of Effect" abilities.
  • Leech - Provides additional healing through damage dealing.
  • Speed - Niche tertiary that can be very useful and has been proven useful in the past. Makes playing certain mechanics a lot easier.

Gear

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight
Best in Slot
Shattering Blade
Farmable Alternatives
!
This is an Absolute BiS List

While these are the items that you should be aiming to acquire for your absolute Best in Slot, these items will not always be the best until you achieve this exact combination of items.

For an accurate representation of what item to equip you should use Simcraft whenever you get what can be an upgrade!

Below you are presented with a good list of farmable alternatives that are obtainable outside of WoWs weekly lockout system. While replaced in time as you progress, these offer immediate character power.

Trinkets

Below you can find active and passive alternatives to our recommended trinkets. Do note that some trinkets are better than others depending on the mythic+ dungeon.

Active Trinket alternatives

If you do not want to play

Treacherous Transmitter because of the minigame involved with its buff, here are the alternatives to get instead.

  • Mark of Khardros

or

  • Skarmorak Shard
    • Essentially the same trinket as
      Mark of Khardros       but gives Mastery when adds die instead of giving slightly more Mastery on demand.

Passive Trinket alternatives

  • Ara-Kara Sacbrood
    • If you do not want to play the minigame of keeping stacks below 20 from
      Ovi'nax's Mercurial Egg      , this is an excellent completely passive alternative.

Embellishments

  • Darkmoon Sigil: Ascension     -- Weapon Only
    • This is a strong embellishment that can only go on your weapon. This does mean taking an item level hit on your off-hand as you can only craft up to 636 item level but it is currently the best option.

and

  • Writhing Armor Banding     -- Armor Only
    • This is a strong embellishment as it buffs your
      Darkmoon Sigil: Ascension       effect by 100%.

Remaining Sparks

  • Crafted items are 636 item level and regular items are 639 on max item level therefore it is not normally beneficial to equip crafted items outside of your 2x Embellishments. Frost Death Knight is a slight deviant from the norm in this regard as we also equip Boots and Helm crafted with Critical Strike and Mastery on them due to high value of those stats for us with no suitable higher item level alternatives. If you have already crafted those two items along with your weapon and have spare sparks and crests remaining, craft other items that you are missing Critical Strike and Mastery on.

Simcraft

To find the best combination of gear available to you or identify the best possible upgrades, visit our Simcraft guide to learn how to utilize Simcraft easily and effectively.

Races

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight

For min-maxing a Frost Death Knight in Mythic+, different racial traits can provide a tremendous benefit to your character. If this is not your top goal, picking a race that fits your style works just as well.

  • Stoneform     -- Dwarf
    • One of the most potent racials in Mythic+ currently and historically.
    • Dispels Magic and Bleed debuffs.
  • Shadowmeld     -- Night Elf
    • Also one of the most potent racials in Mythic+ historically.
    • Use-cases
      • Run past basically any mob and then cast
        Shadowmeld         to make them reset. Even works on mobs that have stealth detection if you get enough distance before you
        Shadowmeld        .
  • Ancestral Call     -- Mag'har Orc
    • Lines up with your major cooldowns perfectly making it is an extremely strong burst racial that grants you 6.5k of one your two highest stats.

Recommendation

If you are serious about pushing Mythic+ as a Frost Death Knight, you need to play either

Dwarf or
Night Elf as they are too strong at avoiding damage and removing important mechanics. If you also raid,
Mag'har Orc is by no means a bad decision as it is the best racial for raiding.

Macros

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight

Discover recommended macros for Frost Death Knight during Mythic+ dungeons and watch a quick video guide on creating simple macros for your character.

Macro Import Guide Video

Cursor Macros

Anti-Magic Zone - Casts 
Anti-Magic Zone at your Cursor position.

/cast [@cursor] Anti-Magic Zone

Death and Decay - Casts
Death and Decay at your cursor position. 

/cast [@cursor] Death and Decay

If you do not like

Death and Decay on your cursor you can replace [@cursor] with [@player] and it will instead put it at your feet. Having either of these is important as it removes the targeting reticle and allows you to get it out faster.

/cast [@player] Death and Decay

Mouseover Macros

Chains of Ice - Casts
Chains of Ice at your mouseover if it exists or your target.

/cast [@mouseover,exists,harm][@target,exists,harm] Chains of Ice

Mind Freeze - Casts
Mind Freeze at your mouseover if it exists or your target.

/cast [@mouseover,exists,harm][@target,exists,harm] Mind Freeze

Death Grip - Casts 
Death Grip at your mouseover target if it exists or your target.

/cast [@mouseover,exists,harm][@target,exists,harm] Death Grip

Raise Ally - Casts
Raise Ally on your mouseover so you can use this on your frames.

/cast [@mouseover,help,dead][]Raise Ally

Focus Macros

Set Focus Mouseover - This will set your focus to your mouseover.

/focus [@mouseover]

Focus

Death Grip - Casts
Death Grip at your focus.

/cast [@focus] Death Grip

Focus

Mind Freeze - Casts
Mind Freeze at your focus. 

/cast [@focus] Mind Freeze

Addons

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight

Below, you see a screenshot of the author's User Interface for their Frost Death Knight, outlining which addons are used and how they are utilized in Mythic+ dungeons to make your life easier.

Addons

  • Echo Raid Tools -- Raid cooldowns and more
    • Helpful addon for Raiders, especially for Raid leaders and officers.
  • ElvUI -- Full User Interface replacement
    • A user interface designed around user-friendliness with extra features that are not included in the standard UI.
    • Alternatively, you can also use Shadowed Unit Frames (SUF) and an action bar addon of your choice or of course the stock UI.
  • BigWigs -- Generic Boss Mod
    • BigWigs is a boss encounter add-on. It consists of many individual encounter scripts, or boss modules; mini add-ons that are designed to trigger alert messages, timer bars, sounds, and so forth, for one specific Raid encounter.
  • WeakAuras -- Jack of all trades
    • WeakAuras is a powerful and flexible framework that allows the display of highly customizable graphics on World of Warcraft's user interface to indicate buffs, debuffs, and other relevant information. This addon was created to be a lightweight replacement for Power Auras but has since introduced more functionalities while remaining efficient and easy to use.
  • Plater -- Advanced Nameplates
    • Plater is a nameplate addon with an extraordinary amount of settings, out of the box debuff tracking, threat coloring, and support for scripting similar to WeakAuras and wago.io + the WeakAuras-Companion for Mod/Script/Profile updates.
  • Details -- In-depth Damage Meter
    • Most powerful, reliable, handsome, damage meter.

WeakAuras

Runes and Runic Power

Shows your current Runes progress and your Runic Power

Defensive Tracker

Shows you when your defensives are up and when externals have been put on you

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight

Patch 11.1

Frost

  • All ability damage increased by 5%.
  • Obliterate     damage increased by 20%.
  • Frost Strike     damage increased by 15%.
  • Rime     now increases the damage of
    Howling Blast     by 275% (was 225%).
  • Breath of Sindragosa     damage increased by 10%.
  • Veteran of the Third War     now increases Stamina by 12% (was 20%), and 6% in PvP combat (was 10%).
  • Null Magic     now reduces the magical damage you take by 5% (was 8%), and 3% in PvP combat (was 4%).
  • Permafrost     now generates an absorb shield at 30% of your auto attack damage (was 40%). 
  • Glacial Advance     visual has been updated.

        Frost Fever        .

        Killing Machine         or

        Reaper's Mark         and 4 stacks when it is a critical strike.

FAQ

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Frost Death Knight

Q: How do
Killing Machine Procs Work?

A: As a 2 Handed Obliteration Frost Death Knight, every auto attack critical strike grants you a stack of

Killing Machine

As a dual-wielding Frost Death Knight, every auto attack critical strike gives you a 30% chance to proc it, stacking up to 4 times meaning at worst you get a

Killing Machine after 4 auto attack critical strikes.

  • 1 Crit = 30% Chance
  • 2 Crits = 60% Chance
  • 3 Crits = 90% Chance
  • 4 Crits = 100% Chance
